page.title: 08SCHOOL, HASELOR, WARKS
page.content: In our school we have three classes. Mrs.Langdon has the infants (4-7yrs), Mrs.Escott, the parttime teacher, has the lower juniors (7-9yrs) and Miss Fox,the Head, has the upper juniors (9-11yrs) except when Mrs.Escott is not here then she has all the juniors. There are usually between 50 and 60 pupils in the school. The juniors have their lessons in the school building and the infants in a temporary class- room. We have a tarmac playground to play on, it is marked with a netball pitch, the girls play and they have some matches against other schools in the area. The boys play football on the pitch in the playing field, they have matches against other schools but they have to have seven a side matches when their are not eleven boys in the juniors. The playing field still has the ridge and furrows on it.
